reviewText: I was looking forward to this movie, My Big Fat Greek Wedding is one of my favorite comedies and I thought this would have just has many laughs. Greece is one of the places on my list, but I haven't been there yet. The movie gave you a great idea of what's its like to visit and had stunning scenery.Unfortunately, beyond the gorgeous historical Greece, this movie didn't have much to offer. The supporting characters were all one-sided and flat. Definitely the cliche tourists. While I would usually find all those cliche touristy things funny, for some reason the main character's(Georgia) gripes about them were neither funny nor entertaining. I just felt she whined incessantly and moped about, and because of that, always got the short end of the stick. And while the 'love interest' was a nice pick, he doesn't say much, and all of a sudden she realizes he'd gorgeous and has so much depth and heart? It wasn't a well developed script, they could have done a lot more with his character and made you really understand and be rooting for them as couple. Now he's just eye candy at this point. The ending was cheesy and putting a cute little happy ending bow on it, when there was really nothing wrong with her life to begin with besides her bad attitude.Lastly... I love special features and there are none. Only a few previews for other movies.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Here is a nice surprise, a film that actually makes you feel good. With quirky funny characters and beautiful locations, what's not to fall in love with?Highly enjoyable romantic comedy, so get on the bus and take the tour, you'll be so glad you did.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Now a days I find it hard to find a movie I enjoy from START to FINISH. But I found that in this movie, I absolutely loved the movie. Nia Vardalos is such a great comedy actress, delightful to watch on screen! Nia & Alex's chemistry was great, I didn't want the movie to end.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I enjoyed this movie.  The plot line isn't anything that will be remembered for millions of years but it is funny and gives you that happy feeling.  Georgia is in Greece working as a tour guide after being laid off from the University she had taught at.  She isn't the best tour guide and tends to bore her tourists with too many facts and not enough beaches.  Her boss Maria decides that if Nikos, another tour guide gets Georgia to quit, he can have a raise.  Nikos tries to sabotage Georgia and her group along the way.  You meet a handful of supporting characters like Popi Cacas, Irv, Dorcas the clepto, etc that add to the charm of the story.  You also get to see some amazing things in Greece, which was the original reason I watched this movie.  Nia Vardalos is charming and pleasant as always.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I actually like this movie more than My Big Fat Greek Wedding. Greece is beautiful and this movie is funny and romantic. I also recommend "I hate Valentine's Day" if you're a Nia Vardalos fan.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: This is a fun movie, but also teaches you to never give up on your dreams. Georgia is an American with Greek ancestry, living in Athens and working as a tour guide. She is super-inspired by all the history surrounding her, and tries to give her tourists the same love for the sites she takes them to, but all they want to do is go to the beach, shop for souvenirs, and get ice cream. She doesn't realize that she needs to make the past alive, until she gets a little help from the bus driver and a widower who show her how it should be done. Soon she becomes the most popular tour guide, and sees her dreams come true.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: For me, `My Life in Ruins' is a colossal failure.  It has all the elements of a failure, and so I should have known walking in that it was going to be bad, but I held out hope because this formula has been known to work when the elements come together in the right way.This film is a waste of time.I say this because `My Life in Ruins' has absolutely no charm.  It has the same scenarios and the same `characters' that all these `finding yourself' romantic comedies has, but it lacks any and all charm.  It is merely a series of events with a slew of mismatched people brought together with reckless abandon to create a hodgepodge of moments we either laugh at (because we have to) or we roll our eyes to.  There needs to be some sort of connective tissue with these films, some sort of entity that draws us in.Nia Vardalos just can't do that.The film follows a single middle-aged (or nearing) woman named Georgia who works as a tour guide in Greece.  She is in love with the culture, but she is disrespected by her boss and co-workers and finds herself consistently stuck with the worst groups and the worst hotels.  When she has finally had enough, she winds up finding happiness thanks to a scruffy driver and a crotchety old widower.Seriously.You can open mouth and insert corn right about now.  The film prides itself on slopping one ridiculous cliché after another right on you plate, with a healthy dose of stereotypes that don't even have the decency to try and appear fresh.  You have the sullen teenager, the crazy Americans, the fighting married couple, the wise old widow(er); etc.  And then you have the forced sentiment that comes in all shapes and forms, from Poupi (yes, you pronounce his name like the stuff in your toilet) explaining why he loves to drive to Irv pretending to be the oracle (the corniest scene in any film I've seen this year).  The jokes are all tired variations of jokes we've heard a million times.  This entire film just feels like a recycled version a every other comedy you've ever seen (almost).  The acting doesn't make up for it either.  I like Vardalos to an extent, but sadly she hasn't been able to capture the magic she ignited with `My Big Fat Greek Wedding' and this surely doesn't help.  Georgoulis may clean up nice, but he's rather flat.  In fact, the only actor who brought anything to the film was Dreyfuss, and sadly he was hampered by being stuck with Mr. Cliché himself.I highly recommend walking far, far away from this movie.  You can throw this on my list of `Worst Films of the Decade', easy.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: This is a wonderful, feel-good movie. I've seen it a couple times and love it more every time. I would definitely recommend.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I cant believe I wasted my money on this.  This movies is so bad it is unbelievable.  Please do your self a favor and do no rent it.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: My wife tells me that when I'm watching movies, I shouldn't get into the problems with technology, physics, time-tables and such.  I can't help it, I found flaws.
summary: It wasn't quite as good as "My big fat Greek wedding"
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: One of my favorite "feel-good movies", well-acted, a busload of interesting (not stereotypical!) characters, and some great shot of Greece as well.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: It helps if you like Nia Vardalos and Greece - some of the scenery is magnificent.  Otherwise cute, silly chick flick.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I loved this movie! Rarely do I end up caring about the people in a comedy, but I did in this one. I was preparing to take a tour which included some time in Greece. The movie focused on the different personality types that one normally finds on a tour group. In this case the group tours Greece in a bus, having all sorts of adventures and misadventures, but getting the real feel of going on a tour. When I came back from my own adventure, I had to watch it again. It was even funnier when I compared it to my own group and the personalities I encountered in real life. It's a fun movie. I never, ever watch movies a second time, but I think it's time for me to watch this one a third time.
summary: Great movie about a tour guide in Greece
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: The 2009 release 'My Life in Ruins' turned out to be a totally unexpected surprise. The scenery is magnificent, the storyline and dialogue sharp and the cast of uniquely quirky characters will keep you throughly entertained from beginning to end. The budding romance between tour guide Georgia (Nia Vardalos) and bus driver Nico (Alistair McGowan) was really quite charming and tourist and self-designated funny man Irv (Richard Dreyfuss) was clearly the secret ingredient that made it all work so well.I particularly enjoyed the way the film incorporated an ongoing subtext suggesting that the Greek Gods may be subtly interacting with the tour and tourists. It was just the right touch of whimsy and depth to supply an added dimension to this delightful romantic comedy.
summary: "This Is Comedy, The Greeks Invented it"
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: A nice traditional middle of the road comedy set in Greece with beautiful scenery.  Some classic characters are mixed together (Vardalos as the 30-something smart single woman looking for Mr Right), a hunky guy for her (the bus driver), a twit/dweeb who gets his comeuppance (Niko, the other tour guide at the company), a slacker 18 year old not sure what country he's in.  There is also a spot-on icy grumpy 40ish British wife.  Real surprises come from a 70-something little old English lady who is a superbly skilled pickpocket - always a giggle and a treat when she has a scene.  Also Brian Palermo has a small role as an IHOP executive constantly talking about pancakes.  But Palmero is also a writer and a top-flight improv comedian, and there are some wonderful 'extra' out-takes where Palmermo creates a series of improv scenes playing the pancake-fixated IHOP executive in a dozen extemporaneous variations.  ("If I wanted to see normal people, I'd go back to Utah" he riffs, and we hear the director yell CUT!).  Personally I felt the first half was more engaging and witty than the second, but overall it's very watchable and a fun effort.  I was prepared not to like it ("chick flick", I thought) and found alot of it very witty.
summary: Nice middle of the road comedy; a few surprise treats
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: This movie features some breathtaking and beautiful scenery of Greece.  Both of the ancient ruins and the current times.  The premise of the film, a down on her luck nerdy history buff who suffers while taking more shallow tourists on tours could be funny, except that the movie starts to get crassy.  The love stories are shallow and the comedy is almost funny.  But not quite.  There are worse movies out there, but also better ones.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Nia Vardalos and the producing team of Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson must be trying to recapture the fifteen minutes of fame they achieved with "My Big Fat Greek Wedding." Otherwise, I don't think any of them would have been involved with "My Life in Ruins." This is one of the worst romantic comedies I've seen in a long time, not so much a film as an exercise in meaningless messages and shallow characters. Only the final half hour shows any degree of entertainment, and even then it's a lost cause simply because the payoff wasn't earned. As a vehicle for director Donald Petrie and screenwriter Mike Reiss, it represents a colossal error in judgment, serving as nothing other than a way to spend ninety minutes out of the house. If you're with a date, good luck trying to make up for it afterwards.The story is about Georgia (Vardalos), a Greek American who moved to Greece hoping to teach classical studies. That didn't pan out, so she became a lowly tour guide on a ramshackle bus with no air conditioning. At the start of the film, she learns that she has been ranked as a merely average guide, which is essentially one step away from getting fired. Her brutally honest boss (Bernice Stegers) tells her that she lacks "kefi," the Greek term for mojo or zest for life. Unfortunately, she doesn't seem too keen on helping Georgia find her "kefi." If anything, she's happy to let Georgia's competition, a bus driver named Nico (Alistair McGowan), do everything he can make her quit. And no wonder--Nico is given the nice-looking bus with the working air conditioner, and he's purposely assigned the nice Canadian tourists who love him for bypassing all the historical landmarks in favor of gift shops and stalls.So what does that leave Georgia? A mishmash of nationalities that no one seems to like. From America, we have Big Al (Harland Williams) and Kim (Rachel Dratch), perfect examples of why foreigners hate American tourists. We have the fat, clueless, slow witted Gator (Jareb Dauplaise), who unknowingly puts on a T-shirt with a Greek phrase that promotes sodomy. We have Marc (Brian Palermo), an IHOP executive who will gladly drone on and on about the history of pancakes and his collection of rare syrups. And then there's Irv (Richard Dreyfuss), another American; he's loud and obnoxious, cracking very unfunny jokes at Georgia's expense. He also serves as the archetypal wise elder, a lonely widower who inspires Georgia with astute observations on life.From England, we have the kind old woman, Dorcas (Sheila Bernette), who doubles as a pickpocket and shoplifter. We also have the snooty Mr. Tullen (Ian Ogilvy), his icy wife (Caroline Goodall), and their moody teenage daughter (Sophie Stuckey), who spends almost the entire film wearing headphones attached to a non-working MP3 player. From Australia, we have a young couple (Simon Gleeson and Natalie O'Donnell) who spout unintelligible slang and are never seen without a can of Fosters in their hands. From Spain, we have two bitter divorcees (María Botto and María Adánaz) who are apparently not bitter enough to keep looking for their respective Mr. Rights.Finally, there's Alexis Georgoulis as the manly Greek bus driver, Poupi, which unfortunately is pronounced like "poopy" (his last name isn't any better). He inevitably becomes Georgia's love interest, although not before he shaves off his thick beard, dresses in nicer clothes, and reveals that he can in fact speak English. He's a student of the Zorba the Greek philosophy, giving Georgia the spiel about living life passionately and without a plan. What no one seems to notice is that he's all talk and no walk. It's not as if he dances in the streets or plays lovelorn melodies on the bouzouki. He's a bus driver, for God's sake. Where's the passion in that?These people are not characters. They're nothing more than caricatures, broadly drawn stereotypes so lacking in depth that they couldn't even aspire to be cardboard cutouts. Even Vardalos, talented though she may be, can't escape the superficiality of her painted face, her bright smile, and her salon-quality hair. Her character is not a woman with genuine problems so much as a byproduct of the romantic comedy paradigm--a nice enough girl trapped in a less-than-ideal situation with no boyfriend. The question is: Will she ever find love, or is she doomed to spend the rest of her days alone? And can she win the hearts and minds of the boorish tourists?Feel free to answer the above questions as you see fit. If there is a reason to see "My Life in Ruins," it would be to look at the ruins, which are not only lovely up there on the screen, but are also hilariously symbolic of the film itself. To say that it goes in the wrong direction would be an understatement; it's tragically misguided, succeeding only as an example of what not to do when making a romantic comedy. It tries to be both an escapist date movie and a message about living life as it happens, but when there's nothing funny or truthful about the story or the characters, all you have is a ridiculous premise about ridiculous people. I can only hope that Nia Vardalos will put this one behind her, after which she can move on to something that will actually connect with the audience.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I've enjoyed every movie Nia has been involved with, whether acting or writing the screenplay, or BOTH.  She never disappoints me.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Georgia is a single woman who works as a tour guide in Greece. She does not like her life because she has not been with a guy in a while, all the tours are the same-with the same kinds of people- and she does not get the best accommodations in buses or hotels.  That is until this tour.There are some interesting characters who ride with Georgia on this particular trip. There is the older kleptomaniac, the dimwitted American tourist couple who want to know if Jesus played on a golf course they were at, an English Couple with a very bored teen aged daughter and a older gentleman who had promised his wife he would go before she died, as well as some Australian tourist.At first Georgia is frustrated that the tourist are more interested in shopping and eating than looking at the historical buildings but with some help from Irv (the widower) played by Richard Dreyfuss she soon gets them interested in the history of Greece as well as finding love the with bus driver.The movie was very good and the locations were amazing. The only problem I had with the movie were the names of the bus driver and his nephew Poupi and Doudi Kakas. Was that really necessary?
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Its funny, I love the actors.  I watched it for 6 days and still cant get enough.  I love the old lady
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Nia Vardalos returns in this "travelogue" as a tour director in Greece, cursed with the tour group from hades (well, almost). She turns her life around, finds her "kefi," and wins the tour groups appreciation.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: You have to give Nia Vardalos the chutzpah award.  The sentiments of love and romance that she espouses in her films aren't necessarily fashionable among the elites (i.e. the critics) yet she's such a firm believer in amore that she goes whole hog in her films.  It wasn't until "My Big Fat Greek Weeding" became a phenomenon that it was given a re-evaluation.  "Connie and Carla" was a gender reversal of "Some Like It Hot".  This film reminds me of a Sixties cult film, "If It's Tuesday It Must Be Belgium".  Vardalos is also aging quite nicely.  She's more beautiful here then she was in "MBFGW".  I also find it interesting that her love interests in these films are usually hunky guys (John Corbett, David Duchovny, Alexis Georgoulis).  In real life she's married to the tubby balding Ian Gomez from the late lamented "Whose Line Is It Anyway".  Gomez has a bit here as the randy hotel concierge.  Needless to say, this film was released in the Summer of '09 a time of year when people aren't looking for the deepthink and are more receptive to Vardalos' worldview.  Credit where credit is due, Vardalos knows her audience and she gives them exactly what they want.
summary: What's Wrong With a Little Schmaltz?
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: On balance the movie is a pleasant evening's entertainment! There is a lot of interesting and beautiful scenery of Greece and the famous ruins there as well as an interesting story about a young woman who has moved to Greece to teach at the university but has wound up as a tour guide.The tourists, unfortunately, do not share her academic fascination with ancient Greek ruins and history and instead, just want to have some fun. Georgia, the young tour guide, played by Nia Vardalos, finds herself being frustrated by their indifference to all she allows herself to hold dear.As the story unfolds, her frustration reaches a breaking point when she writes to her employer that this is her last tour after which she is quitting her job.The second half of the film explorers the impact of two men in her life, one older tourist, played by Richard Dreyfuss, and the young Greek bus driver, played by Alexis Georgoulis. From this point on the movie picks up speed and actually got more interesting and funnier to me.As one might expect, the movie has a happy ending and all turns out for the better. The journey to that point makes for an entertaining evening with a few suggestive scenes but no real nudity. The movie is rated PG-13.
summary: The Tour Guides Road to Freedom
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Not nearly as funny or charming as the movie that came before with the same actress (My Big Fat Greek Wedding). Very formulaic and predictable.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Blerg.I love the actress so I was suprised to come across this movie as I didn't even hear that it came out.  Now I know why.Awful, totally lacking in real character development even for a romantic comedy and utterly unoriginal.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I have to say i though this movie might be a little bit of a knock off of the movie My big Fat Greek Wedding but it wasnt ...it was a charmer all on its own! This film has it all...beautiful scenery, great characters and a lot of real laughs. I really enjoyed it and i think you will too.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: This is a very cute movie but very predictable.  I loved the scenery in Greece and all the ruins were really nice to look at.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Sure, Greece is beautiful--think about Homer's wine dark sea, the cradle of Western Civilization with a shining Parthenon sitting upon the Acropolis looking over the modern city of Athens, ice white windmills gyrating in a sun-drenched blue sky--but in director Donald Petrie's hands in his film "My Life in Ruins," even the cinematography screams: mediocrity.  How could that be in one of the most picturesque countries in the entire world?Well. . . blame it on Hollywood.Another "I Love My Greek Ancestry" vehicle for Greek Canadian actress Nia Vardalos whose one hit wonderMy Big Fat Greek Wedding(2002) still brings a smile to this reviewer's face, "My Life in Ruins" formulaically depicts the now skinny Vardalos as fired professor, now reluctant tour guide, Georgia, whose frustrated existence is summed up in a confession which effectively states she hasn't had sex in quite a long while.  Vardalos, who in "Greek Wedding" portrayed the overweight yet endearing Tula, shed more than just twenty pounds and some major eyebrow hair.  In "Ruins" she misses the mark, seemingly thrilled to show off her new figure and an expertly colored Tina-Fey-as-Sarah-Palin coiffure while sporting ridiculously high heels for her walk up the treacherously steep precipice leading to the Parthenon.  The amusing self-deprecating voice-over of "Greek Wedding" becomes cloying as Vardalos rushes from one scene to another hampered by sappy supposedly introspective dialogue, thanks to screenwriter Mike Reiss and 40-ish spinster woe as she sarcastically critiques her lack of romantic situation and then, of course within the span of two hours, as in all Hollywood fractured fairytales, suddenly switches on the light bulb of attitude adjustment, wins the guy and creates a synergistic miracle amongst all her troubled constituents.Whereas Vardolos had a fine supporting cast in her first film---the marvelous Lainie Kazan and the stoically hysterical Michael Constantine as her old-fashioned parents, (remember the crazy aunt whose biopsy showed teeth)--she is barely bolstered by the group of stereotypical tour bus goers that except for veteran actor Richard Dreyfus as the tour's self-appointed schtick-y comedian are simply not all that memorable.  Love interest Alexis Georgoulis definitely radiates attractive male charisma as he transforms from a hairy voiceless creature from Hades to a philosophy spouting demi-god with a six-pack.  However, he doesn't have the well-honed chemistry of John Corbett whose white bread sensitivity and boyish charm offset perfectly Tula's shy and unabashed vulnerability to create movie wow.  Couple Ruin's weak cast with an even weaker storyline: misfit tour director bonds with her disgruntled group to eventually form a mini-village of helping hands complete with the requisite happy ending.Bottom line:  Skip this one.  For a good film about Greece look atZorba the GreekorNever on Sunday.  Even the 1982 filmSummer Lovers (Full Screen Edition)managed to convey the magic of Greece and its islands even though the story line is definitely R rated.Diana Faillace Von Behren"reneofc"
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I bought this movie and instantly fell in love with the characters and the plot line. Nia Vardalos plays a woman who lives in a place where everyone has spirit and lives life to the fullest. Still hung up on losing her dream job she is stuck giving tours around Greece to the same tour groups. This time her tour group has a lesson for her to learn. Funny and fun packed movie.
summary: Great lessons for life and love.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: The clichés come fast and furious in this superficial 2009 comedy that fails to deliver anything close to wit or insight beyond the level of a Hallmark greeting card. In what amounts to be a sitcom remake of 1969'sIf It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium, a farce that depicted the whirlwind antics of an American tour group in Europe, this film is even more dependent on stock characters and situations that appear transported from an Eisenhower-era story. Seven years after her unexpected success withMy Big Fat Greek Wedding, star Nia Vardalos looks slimmer and more glamorous than she did in her debut, yet she portrays almost the same self-defeating character as Georgia, a history professor who came to Greece to teach but ends up leading tourists around its ancient ruins. Disappointed with the cards life has dealt to her, she is uptight about her job much to the consternation of her group who want only to have fun rather than an education on ancient Greece.Directed by Donald Petrie (Miss Congeniality) and written by Mike Reiss (episodes ofThe Simpsons) in an extremely slapdash fashion, the story focuses on how Georgia has lost her passion for life (called "kefi" in Greek) and how it takes the motley tour group and her attraction to a studly bus driver named Poupi to rediscover it. Vardalos is a likeable presence, but her screen persona is getting redundant as her depiction of an everywoman becomes less credible with her every appearance. Richard Dreyfuss is really slumming here as an avuncular Jewish widow named Irv who acts as Georgia's wizened counselor in love and life. Yet, his Oscar-winning chops at least make his stereotype less offensive and brain-draining than the other actors, in particular, Harland Williams and Rachel Dratch as a mouthy American couple. As Poupi, Greek actor Alexis Georgoulis looks initially like Grizzly Adams, but love transforms him into smoldering eye candy as the movie progresses, which is really the whole point of his role. Rita Wilson shows up in a sentimental cameo as Irv's deceased wife since she and husband Tom Hanks served as executive producers (same as they did with "My Big Fat Greek Wedding").With cinematography by frequent Pedro Almodóvar collaborator José Luis Alcaine, the Greek locations are refreshing, even though the environs around Valencia, Spain, apparently doubled for much of the country. The 2009 DVD oddly offers three separate commentary tracks from Vardalos, Petrie and Reiss. Vardalos' track is charming but marred by long pauses since she seems to miss someone prompting her to speak, while Petrie's is understandably more technical in nature. Surprisingly, the most entertaining commentary is provided by Reiss, a genuine comedy writer who convinces us that the story is based on his real-life experiences as part of a tour group. There are twelve minutes worth of deleted and alternate scenes, including an excisable alternate ending, and a comic three-minute featurette, "Everybody Loves Poupi", that Petrie created by re-editing some of the footage. Even though Vardalos is not at the helm this time (unlike the far more execrable "I Hate Valentine's Day" released a month later), I have a feeling that she has more talent than this movie allows her to display.
summary: Shallow Stereotype-Driven Sitcom Shows If It's Tuesday, It Must Be Athens
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Another of Nia's excellent films!  Actually love My Big Fat Greek Wedding more but it's still a keeper!  Our heroine is a tour guide in her much beloved Greece while awaiting a job as a teacher at college.  She's under paid, over-worked, gets the gnarly end of the stuff at work and mostly miserable but she tries to put on a brave face despite all of that.  When her tour group and she come together eventually both grow, love ensues and a warm fuzzy feeling blankets all.  Above all it is filmed in Greece!  How great is THAT!?
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: So isMy Life in Ruinsas funny as the surprise hitMy Big Fat Greek Wedding? Maybe not quite there, but I think it's pretty close. The jokes are funny, but the film is moving as well. Richard Dreyfuss brings a lot to the film, combining comedy with wisdom. As the characters begin to enjoy themselves on the trip to Greece, the viewer will too.Only problem: I wish the DVD had deleted scenes. I'd love to see what was spliced out.
summary: Last funny movie I've seen since... My Big Fat Greek Wedding
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Very fun, lighthearted family movie!  We ended up buying it because we liked it so much!  Richard Dreyfus is a hoot, as is "Poopie!
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Evey bit as enjoyable as My Big Fat Greek Wedding.  Nia Vardolos and her supporting case make this a true pleasure to watch again and again.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: The story was good; the characters were funny ....but the real star of the show was the beautiful scenes in Greece. I want to go there now !
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Three stars because I bought it.  I bought it because "My Big Fat Greek Wedding" always seems to end to soon, and while this movie is no relation to that one, it serves well as dessert.  That said, this isn't nearly as good as MBFGW.  The plot is simple:  An American college professor of Greek Art History is out of work and doing tours between offers, in Greece.  She wants to share the fine parts of Greek culture with tourists who want to shop, eat ice cream, and suntan at the beach.  She's very uptight.  Because the forward motion of the movie is largely dependent on a bus, the bus is filled with stick figures draped in stereotypes, and so we never really develop a relationship with them, that we had--to some extent--in MBFGW.  Two actors play Aussies, which means a couple hugging cans of Fosters and uttering gibberish from the Book Of Aussie Slang, and nothing else.  The eastern European women say nothing, but dress in print dresses circa 1958.  The Americans all play shades of dumb and rude, save for Richard Dreyfus who plays a God of sorts, and always utters something pithy.  It is Dreyfus' character who helps Nia's character to loosen up.  It takes about half the movie for the film to get moving.Again, I bought it because I liked "My Big Fat Greek Wedding", and recommend it accordingly, to those fans.  If you're considering this film without having seen the other;  I'd first recommend "My Big Fat Greek Wedding", instead, or, "Bread And Tulips" which is an Italian effort (with subtitles) that has a similar vein (to this film) in that it starts on a tour (of Italy) and ends in Venice, but has more developed characters and a better story.  On the other hand, if you're snow or rain bound, and want something light, and have some good popcorn and real butter, you won't hate yourself for watching "My Life in Ruins".
summary: Good.  Not As Good As My Big Fat Greek Wedding.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: what FUN!  this is a romantic comedy that is not just about a boy and girl getting together:  it is an ensemble piece about the joys of being true to who one is.  nia vardalos never looked better and her wardrobe, for a change, is complimentary; acting chops are better tuned, as well.  the on-screen chemistry between nia and alexis georgoulis is combustible:  no wonder the greek tabloids touted an off-screen romance between the two; and did everything they could to prove it, too.  casting directors should cast georgoulis in more flicks in this country; he's a real screen presence.  the rest of the ensemble are pitch-perfect; what a joy to watch them all.yes, this flick is full of stereotypes; what romantic comedy isn't?  afterall, stereotypes are stereotypes because they are recognizable characters from time immemorial:  we KNOW these people. so, drop your defenses, relax, and enjoy this romp through greece.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Funny move.  I liked it a lot.  Movie arrived as stated.  Would buy from this company again.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Although Nia Vardalos was great (better than in My Big Fat Greek Wedding) what really struck me in watching this film was how well done even most of the minor characters were.  Saying that "Greece is the real star" (from the promo) was simply dumb. Yes the scenery was spectacular but this is really a film about people. I thoroughly enjoyed this film.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: This movie is a good one, romantic comedy, very funny! I highly recommend it, the sights of Greece are beautiful!
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I am sure someone won't like this review because I am only giving "My Life in Ruins" one star. Everyone is entitled to their opinion, including me.That being said, I'll begin my review with this question: Why was this movie made? Aside from the beautiful scenery in Greece, there was no reason to watch it. My wife and I sat through only 40 minutes waiting for something funny to be said by someone, by anyone, before we gave up. Both of us were embarrassed for the lead actress Nia Vardalos. She was terrific in "My Big Fat Greek Wedding", but seemed to be struggling to salvage something even marginally humorous from this mess of a movie. The plot was unbelieveable and silly. A college professor, Vardalos, is laid off from her position as a teacher of Greek History and can only find work as a tour guide. She shows her party of tourists (a busload of stereotypes: obnoxious Americans, drunken Australians, hot and hungry for love Spaniards, a bored teenager forced by her parents to take the tour with them, an unfunny guy who tries desperately to string out flat one-liners, etc.) the sights in and around Athens, informing them, without success, about the history and culture of the early Greeks at the ancient ruins they visit, when all the people on the tour really want to do is shop and eat. None of this was a bit funny to us.If you want to see a good movie, full of humor, beautiful scenery of Greece, and, yes, romance, watch "Shirley Valentine". Now THAT'S a movie both my wife and I can recommend.
summary: We waited 40 minutes for this movie to be funny. We're still waiting.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: As a warning, this is NOT My Big Fat Greek Wedding.  With that said, its a cute film.  Lighthearted and good natured.Nia Vardalos (Georgia) is an Ancient HIstory Professor that lost her job at the university in Greece and has resorted to being a tour guide till she waits for another teaching job.  As an uptight individual she finds her "mojo" during what she thinks is her last tour.It is not side-splitting comedy like Greek Wedding, but it is an enjoyable film.  It starts a little slow but gains moementum.  There are many stereotypical characters but that seems to be the "genre" of the film.  The sites are breathtaking and leaves you with a strong desire to visit Greece.Richard Dreyfuss is sweet as the funny sage and there are moments of melancholy that leave you quite moved.  It is NOT loaded with profound social commentary and in your face realism, but who needs that ALL THE TIME?  Seems the editing shorted the characters on depth, but this contributes to its lightheartedness.It is great for an evening rental.  Enjoy!
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: It's a fun, lighthearted movie, the scenery is beautiful, and the actors are great.  It reminds me of other films with Nia Vardalos, but stands on its own quite well.  Very enjoyable.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I had heard some pretty negative things about this movie before I saw it, so I was glad to find out that it was actually pretty good. It's not as good as My Big Fat Greek Wedding was, but it was definitely funny and had some very cute moments. The only thing I didn't like about it was that sometimes it felt like it was just too much of a whine-fest.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: This is a nice sequel to the original. Obviously, the original was better, but this movie still made me laugh. It's funny because my family is the exact same way. We're Greek.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: It was okay in a way!  But there are a lot of stupid moves in the movie, but the romance was good.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I have been on these group tours throughout Europe and all the different characters, the problems and mishaps you see in this film are right on the mark about package tour travel in this heartwarming comedy set in beautiful Greece. With filming locations all around the city of Athens and the ancient sites of Olympia and Delphi, you will feel like you're on tour yourself watching this movie. And if you enjoyed the comedy If It's Tuesday, This must Be Belgium from 1969 then you should love this comedy of errors on tour group travel also.
summary: Listening To The Sound Of Wind Through The Columns
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Nia is very fun and talented in this role.  She is competent and cute, more like her I Hate Valentines Day role than Big Fat Greek Wedding.  The love interest is realistic and sexy.  Richard Dreyfus plays a great role.  It is entertaining escape.
summary: Funny and entertaining with great scenery
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Great movie...lots of fun to watch for  everyone..would definitely recommend this for family movie time or a. Date night..loved it
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I loved "Greek Wedding," so figured this would be a good bet.  Unfortunately, it didn't move me beyond it just being ok.  I could have passed but I don't regret spending the time on it.  It's an ok movie but I wouldn't watch it again.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: again one great movie she had to do with.  I enjoyed every minute of it.  I already watched it 3x.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Well, Nia Vardalos does it again...such charm...so believable.  Richard Dreyfuss adds a great perspective, and let's face it...the bus driver is nothing to sneeze at.  A great message...love is usually where you least expect it.  It's a keeper!
summary: My Life in Ruins ~ an excellent choice!
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: If you've ever been part of a tour group in a foreign country, you'll be able to relate to My Life In Ruins.  If the characters are over the top caricatures and the predicaments they find themselves in a little too bizarre to be believable, that's OK.  This is a romantic comedy and nobody expects it to be realistic.  What we do expect is for it to be funny, and though it tried really really hard, it's not, though not a total waste of time. I enjoyed spending an hour and a half in Greece, but Zorba The Greek this movie isn't.My Life In Ruins does not flow. The actors knock themselves out demonstrating growth from misfit geekiness to warm fuzzy family, but it's not quite believable.  Don't get me wrong.  I heart everybody in this film, especially Nia Vardalos, and it's not any of the actors' faults that the material simply isn't good.Sometimes when film writing and casting stars align, magic is made--Gigi, When Harry Met Sally, Moonstruck, and My Big Fat Greek Wedding for example.  What makes them magic is that all the characters are appealing. My Life In Ruins is not magic--very few of the characters are likeable.  They could have been, and Greece deserves better.Poor Ms. Vardalos.  Her forte is self-deprecating humor and at her best, we're included in the jokes.  It's too bad she can't seem to find a screenwriter who understands her strengths and can write a script around them.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: What a funny, charming, and warm movie this is.  Nia Vardalos is a tour guide named Georgia who really has lost her smile and considers her great job as a tour guide in Greece as just a history lesson.  She then takes a group of unforgettable tourists on an "oddysey" of opening up and having fun along the way.  She has a bus driver that looks like at first a caveman whose name is "Poopie Kakas" that during the journey comes to care for her and cleans himself up.  There are typical American tourists, British, Australian, Spanish, and unidentifiable tourists as well.  They become great friends at the end.  The scenery in Greece is absolutely beautiful.  Richard Dreyfuss is a man who makes this trip for his wife and is the "wise" man along the way.Funny moments, charming plot, great acting, and you can tell the cast had alot of fun filming this make this a movie for one who likes beautiful scenery, warm and enjoyable plot, and truely funny scenes!  Highly Recommended!
summary: Funny, charming, and wonderful scenery make this a winner!
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I wasn't expecting much of this movie, but I was very surprised.  The story itself I'd give 3, maybe 3/12 stars for, it was good, but very much like any other romantic comedy out the last 10 years or so.  The other stars come for the location, which should have gotten top billing.  The camera work was incredible, the entire movie was visually stimulating.  I haven't been Greece since my days living in Germany in the 80's and I had forgotten just how beautiful it is out there.  For a pretty good movie and a fantastic backdrop, it's worth seeing.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: i enjoyed this movie a good bit.  i especially enjoyed seeing the main characters man later on in the movie.  He was very nice to look at.
summary: nice movie to sit and relax
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed this show. I don't watch many movies, but after watching the trailer on this decided to rent it. I really enjoyed it, I laughed out loud. Does it measure up to Big Fat Greek Wedding? Yes I think it did in many ways. I think there are those who think it doesn't, because we weren't familiar with Nia Vardalos in Greek Wedding, we weren't expecting to enjoy it as much as we did, there was more of the surprise factor-if you were looking for that you will be somewhat disappointed.This movie, as Greek Wedding, is full of quirky characters, humor, scenes that will touch your heart and situations almost anyone can relate with. And it added the bonus of a peek into the flavor of Greece almost as if you are there as a tourist.I don't rent many movies and purchase even less, but I think I will buy this one.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: My 9 yr old granddaughter put this on her Xmas wish list as a Number One request.She is part Greek which explains the main reason about the movie.  It is a delightful, romantic story filmed in Greece.  This same actress made the movie"My Big Fat Greek Wedding."  The wedding was similar to my son [blonde, blue-eyed, fair complexion] and his bride [Greek 100%].  So, our families love movies that Nia makes.
summary: Romantic comedy for kids and adults
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Not quite Greek Wedding, this flick has its moments of charm and is at times amusing. However, it feels more like a Lifetime movie than a Hollywood blockbuster. The humor gets annoyingly sexual and predictable. For example, the bad guy in the film gives a t-shirt to someone on the "opposing side." The guy puts it on, not knowing what the Greek characters say, and becomes an instant magnet for certain locals. Turns out it was implying he was searching for a boyfriend. The romantic thread is predictable as well. But, that's not to say people aren't going to find it to be an okay and entertaining way to spend an evening, especially if they like the genre and the premise. I'd suggest giving it a Red Box/rental trial before purchasing.
summary: Some Charm But...Rent It Before Buying
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Georgia (Nia Vardalos) is an American living in Greece and working as a tour guide. She hates her job, thinks all tourists are idiots, and is sick of Greece, too.  But on her next four-day trip everything will change for the better, thanks to the quirky members of her tour and her moody bus driver.This movie had so much potential but is really terrible.  It's neither funny nor romantic and the dopey cast is always blocking our view of beautiful Greece.  The plot is a rip-off ofIf It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgiumbut lacks its charm and good script.  Vardalos' self-deprecating character that was so witty inMy Big Fat Greek Weddingis just tedious here, making her transformation at the end ridiculous.  The tourists all have one-dimensional personalities and are uniformly corny and over-the-top.  Veteran actor Richard Dreyfuss plays the sterotypical saintly old man who turns Georgia's life around by urging her to find her "spirit."  I was fascinated that he looked so much like Eli Wallach but he's such a know-it-all that I couldn't stand him.  Rachel Dratch is also extremely grating as a fellow passenger on the Bus of Fools and there's nothing appealing about Alexis Georgoulis who plays the object of Georgia's affection.Stick withIf It's Tuesdayfor a genuinely funny look at the trials of the guided bus tour.  The DVD has no Extras at all.  I gave it two stars for the lovely scenery.
summary: How do you say "dud" in Greek?
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: This is a fun movie to watch.  I enjoyed Nia Vardalos in the Greek Wedding...so I was sure to enjoy her in this movie as well.  I was not disappointed and I have watched this several times since receiving it.  I bought a second copy as a gift because I know the person I am going to give it to...will enjoy just as much.  Good movie and lost of fund.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I rented this movie one night when I didn't feel well and I was thoroughly surprised with how cute it was!  It actually made me laugh out loud a few times.  The story isn't anything spectacular, and some of the comedic scenes are a little over-the-top, but ultimately, it was really fun and quite enjoyable.  The scenery, however, was beautiful - it made me want to hop on a plane and explore ancient Greece!I love Nia Vardalos, and while she wasn't as great as she was in My Big Fat Greek Wedding, I still found her very funny with a fantastic spark about her.  I also loved Richard Dreyfuss, but especially Rachel Dratch and Harland Williams!  They were fantasticly fun and ridiculous as always!If you're in the mood for a lighthearted, corny, romantic-comedy - look no further!
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I suggest you see it too. You never know what it's like to be so upset until you watch this.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: If you've ever dreamed of a vacation in Greece, you've got to watch this movie. Is it lightweight? Yes. Is it formulaic? Sort of. Does any of that matter? No. This is a feel good, romantic comedy of the type not made much anymore. Nia Vardalos (My Big Fat Greek Wedding) is perfect as the American who came to Greece to teach and ended up as a brainy tour guide when the economy tanked. Her competition is a smarmy, ingratiating guy who plays up to the women although he's gay. But he seems to know what tourists want, while Georgia is intent upon imparting history. Richard Dreyfuss is at the top of his game as a widower hiding his grief behind an obnoxious, wisecracking exterior. The hunk in this film is Alexis Georgoulis as the tour bus driver, who falls for Georgia long before she gives him a second glance. The cast is filled out by various "types", and as they travel together, they also change a bit together. Don't look for any great philosophical moments, or even any breathtaking cinematography here. But if you're looking for an evening of decent, family friendly romp of a movie, you could do a lot worse than My Life in Ruins.
summary: A comfy, amusing visit to Greece
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: What an unfortunate mix.  I give romantic comedies a lot of "grace" because I always start by giving them the benefit of the doubt and really want them to be entertaining. I don't analyze them if they make me feel good. Yet I was actually cringing with embarrassment at the stereotypical characters they rolled out for this one.  I think I saw Richard Dreyfuss cringing at one point too!  The simplistic portrayals of each canned category of tourist were actually offensive at times. Yet seen as a travelogue, the scenery was breathtaking, some of the best ever!  Also, it's hard to dislike Nia, and Richard even managed to redeem his character somehow.  So see it for the scenery if you can prepare yourself to hang in there with the rest.  Three stars are for the scenery, but about 1 1/2 for the rest of the mess.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Love this movie.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: i loved the beautiful tours of greece and loved hearing about the history and it was sweetly funny.  loved Nia Vardalos in this
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I found this movie to be very enjoyable, as well as the comedy..It had a great story, good emotions and acting...Richard Dreyfuss was in usual form..older..but great...I liked the way the group of tourist became sort of a family and the tour guide learned a lot from them..Anyway..I would recommend it highly.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Nia Vardalos the star of My Big Fat Greek Wedding was incredible in this movie and learned many lessons about love and live with the help of her tour bus driver and a little old man played by Richard Dryfuss.If you haven't been to Greece and have dreamed of going, watch this movie.  I needed a good laugh and it delivered.  Reminded me of my days working in travel and being an escort along with my husband on a Med cruise.Photography incredible, and secondary characters, amazing which made for a very entertaining movie.
summary: So much fun, reminded of my Greece trip!
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I was looking forward to this movie very much after enjoying My Big Fat Greek Wedding, that is until I read many neutral to negative reviews.  I finally gave in and decided to go for it and while this isn't as good as that movie I still found it very enjoyable to watch.  There isn't much real depth and the story is pretty cliche but I enjoyed it in all of it's frivolity.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Nia Vardalos was adorable, just like she was in "My Big Fat Greek Wedding"...I have personally toured Greece and have been to Athens, Olympia and Delphi just like they showed in the movie.  Richard's part was so like him in that he is another great actor that can "play" any character and be so great and adorable at the same time.I am a "first generation Greek" in America and could understand the Greek that was spoken as well as the English so I was entertained by both languages spoken. That was a very special treat for me personally.The movie was sweet, cute and a great show of how the Greeks in Greece really are in their ability to "bargain" and "seduce" tourists.  I experienced it first hand and the tour that I was on, was the same tour that they took us on in the film.The scenery is so breathtaking and beautiful and Delphi really does "change" you in a very subtle way that even I came away touched by the oracles of Delphi.  The day that we were there was sunny and balmy and it was my favorite day in the 14 days that we were in Greece.The story line was, to me, portrayed in such an enjoyable, sweet way and, of course, I was once again so touched to know that Rita Wilson and Tom Hanks were the ones that brought us this film just like they saw to it that "My Big Fat Greek Wedding" was their undertaking after seeing the play.I feel personal pride in being Greek as is Rita Wilson and she has the ability to let the rest of the world experience, in a "family way," what it is to be a Greek in North America.  I actually thought I was the only little Greek girl "in the world" that didn't get to become a "Brownie" because I HAD to go to Greek School.  That was a "special moment in time" for me. to say the least.Thank you, Rita and Tom, for allowing the rest of the world to actually become a part of the Greek culture in such an entertaining way and what you did was "right on" about what we, as Greeks, are all about and in such a "tender" way.Another "A" movie on my list.
summary: beautiful scenery and a Greek Tour for entertainment
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: When my 83 yo Grandfather and I think of Nia Vardalos, the first movie that pops up isMy Life in Ruins.  Sure we'll recall her other films and the notorious "My Big Fat Greek Wedding."  But this one stands out because it's a good comedy.Nia Vardalos is a very talented woman.  I've seenMy Big Fat Greek WeddingandI Hate Valentine's Day (Widescreen).  But I really prefer "My Life in Ruins."  It's a great comedy film.  Sure it's got some romance but the humor outshines.Apparently the script started with Mike Reiss and then Nia re-wrote it.  So it has a mix of "The Simpsons" and "Greek Wedding."  Then there's "Saturday Night Live" gal - Rachel Dratch.  And then Richard Dreyfuss as "God" Irv Gideon.  These and other cast members were all perfect.  They had perfect chemistry and just the right amount of attitude.I did not know that it was the first time any production was able to film "The Acropolis" (according to Wikipedia and the "London Guide").  I was in the Navy for 4 years and blessedly visited about 8 countries.  I've been on various tours and made quick tours ourselves (being that each visit lasted no more than 4 days).Seeing this movie reminded me of the adventure of traveling and sight seeing.  Some of the stereotypes in this movie is spot on and others are exaggerations, but this is a movie.  A comedy at that.  The exaggerations helped give it an extra bit of comedy.So I own this movie through iTunes.  I've watched it countless times and I recommend this for a good laugh.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I wanted to like this movie but it just wasn't all that to me. There was too much CRAP for me to find it worth watching. Nia Vardalos' acting was good as usual but the content was stupid. The main character is told the whole movie she needs to "BE" with someone...it will make her feel better. There is a scene where another character is participating in a threesome. This 'chick flick' doesn't qualify for me!'
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Yes this movie is a chick flick as it is 1 of 1000's of romantic comedies out there. But if you can look past that there are some positives to point out. The acting of Nia Vardalos was great and I think better than her acting in My Big Fat Greek Wedding (which was very good). The movie was pretty entertaining with an intriguing storyline. The camera work was outstanding as the scenes in Greece were visually stunning. The movie is sweet, very funny, cute and entertaining.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I love the main actor she is really good. I love how she find true love in this movie where she was not looking
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Ohhh, Nia Vardalos is just one of those beautiful women in her late ages, very funny movie, very romantic and emotional that captures your heart. This movie also shows diversity through other cultures with mixed people from around the globe.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: The movie has beautiful scenery so love that, the story is moving and funny, with a couple of sad moments as well.  All in all you have a great mixed package of a feel good movie to enjoy over and over again.  Barbara. Australia.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: My first thought was that this movie had potential and it would be at least decent. The start of the movie was decent but it quickly became what I call a DISNEY movie - corny, predictable, and embarassing to watch and...predictable and corny, oh wait I said that but it deserves to be mentioned twice.Bad movie, horribly disappointing. DISNEY almost Hallmark quality movie. Disney should stick to animated movies, they're much better, just want to add that even though it doesn't relate to this movie.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I think Nia Vardalos is a fantastic actress, and Richard Dreyfuss is one of my favorite actors.  That said, I don't understand how either of these fine actors ended up in this pitiful movie.  It is crude, the script is terrible and the storyline is senseless.  This movie should have been wonderful, being that it takes place in Greece.  It might as well have been made in a backyard alley somewhere!
summary: Zeus is probably enraged by this move
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I liked Nia Vardalos much better in , My Fat Greek Wedding, and I hate Valentine's Day... I saw My Life in Ruins this past Monday on the television. And really was too silly and the movie didn't get good until the last 45 minutes. I like a funny movies but, it was not that good at all. It didn't keep my interest... I will not be adding this movie to my collection.. I wish they showed other parts of her life in this movie. Instead of the whole movie just on her being a traveling guide.. Not one of her best by far! Save your money! This movie isn't worth buying..Not worth a second look! A so-so movie.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I loved this sweet and light movie for several reasons, the main one being Nia.  She is so appealing and seems like an old friend--that is, if you are lucky enough to have a friend like her!  Nia also wrote this hilarious movie, and you will recognize people you know who are just like some of the characters. Another reason I love it is the breathtaking scenery of Greece, which I have dreamed of visiting. The hilarious tourists and the endearing love stories make this a great film for everyone. You will also love the dotty old couple, the handsome bus driver, the nasty tour guide and Richard Dreyfuss, who is very appealing. I know this movie received some poor reviews, but it is silly fun and harmless, and Nia is the best.  I wish she would do more films. She also is wonderful in CONNIE AND CARLA. Shakespeare it is not...but great fun and hilarious characters it is.You won't be able to take your eyes off Nia, who like Fran Drescher, channels Lucille Ball in her performances--and that is a high compliment.
summary: Nia is a lovable instant classic!
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I was looking forward to seeing this movie because I love beautiful scenery and this movie delivers that in spades.  I was not really drawn to anything else in the movie.  None of the characters made an enormous impact on me and the script was mediocre.  There were a few funny moments, but nothing particularly memorable.  There was no chemisty between the leading actors, but there was something fun and quirky about the movie.  In other words, if you are looking for romance, this is not the movie.  If you are looking for mindless entertainment and a nice visual trip, it's worth checking out.It's a decent rental because once you've seen it, the magic is gone.  I had no desire to watch this movie again.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewerName: Rev. Donna M. Swindells "Art House Diva"
reviewText: "My life in ruins" was a very pleasant surprise. I wasn't sure how this movie would play out. I am a lover of Greek mythology & its beautiful and historic temples. This movie let me see these temples & Greek ruins up close, even through the eyes of a passionate tour guide.The only reason I gave it a 4 star review was the love story written in the plot. It was a pretictable story, but the Greek views, buildings and history overcomes it easily. Lovers of Greece rejoice, and enjoy the view.Donna Swindells
summary: Seeing Greece through the eyes of a Tour Guide
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Was a big fan of MY BIG FAT GREEK WEDDING and ond of Nia Vardalos, and was expecting something similar.  However, I was very disappointed. It is a badly acted and predictable comedy that isn't particularly funny. Even the greek guy doesnt look as hot in the movie as he does in the picture on the cover of the DVD box!  Don't bother seeing this movie!

The people she is working with are strange!She finally hooks up with the Driver of the Bus (Alexis Georgoulis).  It is a shame this is just an okay movie. reviewText: I had rented the movie than I just had to buy it, I really like Nia Vardalos and some of the oter movies she has been in !!!

What is wrong with a scenic movie witout four letter words and buildings blowing up? A little love? a little nostalgia? a little humor?

reviewText: Perhaps the best movie that nina Vardalos ever made.  She is just wonderful as a women who is still looking for the meaning of life.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: absolute love this movie; funny and if you have ever been on a guided tour, it makes it worth watching even more; we bought this and have watched it over and over; one of those movies that you watch again down the road
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: My review title here should read Entertaining, but probably best as a rental (think Unbox).  While I can see some viewers enjoying this enough to add it to their collection, and certainly the location shots of the wonder and splendor that is Greece shines through, the story here just doesn't rise to the level of something that would likely be viewed multiple times.I give the writers credit for not going for the completely contrived and predictable, but then again what is here is barely above that.  There's humor in watching Georgia (Nia Vardalos) struggle in her job as a tour guide, but the setup is a bit too convenient.  Her tour group, Group B, is a mix of charicatures of various types all of which come together as a perfect mix of personalities that all wind up fitting too neatly with the rest of the group.  As the tour moves along Georgia winds up watching her rival tour guide leading his group, group A, in fun activities that makes her own group jealous and distracted.By the end of the flick, well, let me not give away the ending, even though it's fairly well telegraphed (heck, a blind person could likely see where things are going to go here).  Just be cautioned in advance that what you're watching, while cute, sweet, funny and somewhat entertaining, is also headed right where you expect.Personally I enjoyed the film more than I thought I would, and found several laughs along the way, but again, not enough to inspire me to give this film a buy it recommendation.  Err on the side of caution, rent first if possible.  Those that have an appreciation for Greek history might enjoy this more, and certainly it's a date night flick that both male and female can enjoy, but multiple viewings seems to be a value that just isn't achieved here.
summary: Entertaining, but probably best as a ...
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: I have a degree in Art History, so maybe I'm biased about Greek antiquities and can relate to the life of a tour guide. But really this film was hilarious and really entertaining. Sadly it seems like Nia Vardalos has been 'dismissed' for not coming out with another Big Fat Greek Wedding (even though she still works with many actors from that cast), when really she's got so much more to offer comedically then just a mere sequel. This movie is definitely about finding one's self during circumstances one would rather change.  It's about stepping back, letting things happen, and enjoy life as a result; NOT about trying to control what's beyond our control. Stopping to smell the roses, even when they're not there. The actors in the tour group are a laugh out loud riot. And Richard Dreyfuss goes from being a grumpy old man to lovable in the blink of an eye. Great movie, great acting.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: This movie was refreshing change of pace. Every cast member fit in this movie like a piece of the puzzle. I felt like I was watching a romance novel unfold and it was every bit as entertaining as the read would've been. This role was made for our Main Character. She was splendid and funny and believable. This movie is worth a watch if not a buy. It may well be an add on my Christmas this year.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: Let me start by saying that even if you see this movie and do not like the story, the scenery alone is awesome and worth the purchase price.  You get to see many tourist areas of Greece without the cost of a plane ticket to go to Greece (although, I definitely would love to be in Greece and see these places in person).  I think the story line is great too.  Nia Vardalos has certain aspirations and has a different perspective of how she viewed people and just life in general.  She was a tourist guide and was simply burned out.  With the help of some of the tourists more specifically Richard Dreyfuss, she begins to see life differently.  As a result, she had also found love.  If you are considering this movie, definitely give it a try.  As I mentioned earlier, even if you feel the story was horrible, you will not be disappointed by the scenery.
Title: My Life in Ruins

reviewText: My Life in Ruins is a mildly watchable romantic comedy, mildly funny and mildly entertaining. The acting is OK. That said, the movie is also somewhat boring and extremely predictable and cliched. Mild spoiler warning: Yes, watch as the shaggy, odd bus driver gradually transforms throughout the movie until he is a sleek, clean shaven, perfectly coiffed, sharply dressed handsome romantic partner by the end. See what I mean by predictable and cliched? Richard Dreyfuss adds a little bit extra to the movie, enough to keep it going, but there are a lot better movies you could spend your precious time watching. This is stricly 2 stars.
summary: No big fat greek wedding here
Title: My Life in Ruins
